USA: Crédit Mobilier scandal: The scandal takes place.
U.S. presidential election, 1872: An election is held.
Philippine: 200 Filipinos, mostly soldiers, stage a mutiny in Cavite.
Priests Mariano Gomez, José Apolonio Burgos, and Jacinto Zamora (together known as Gomburza) are implicated in the Cavite Mutiny and executed.
Germany: Kulturkampf: The School Supervision Act was passed, transferring all religious schools to state control.
Colombia: Manuel Murillo Toro is President of the United States of Colombia for second time
Brazil: In the aftermath of the Paraguayan War, the new government of Paraguay makes peace with Brazil, grants reparations and territorial concessions.
Brazil conducts its first official census, the population is 9,930,478.
Australia: The Overland Telegraph Line linking Darwin and Adelaide opened.
